disobedience.question: Did you deliberately skip an obligatory day, such as Ash Wednesday, without a valid excuse?

disobedience.question: Did I condone the scattering or improper disposal of human remains, thereby disrespecting the dignity of the deceased?
disobedience.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

disobedience.question: Did I scorn or mock the Church through my words?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I, in my words or actions, mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over fulfilling my financial obligations to others
prodigality.question: Have I excessively prioritized my own leisure activities over fulfilling my financial obligations to others, thereby neglecting my responsibilities?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, during social gatherings or online interactions?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs or faults through words, even if what was shared was true?

impiety.question: Did I engage in any unnecessary activities on Sunday, such as work-related tasks or volunteering, when it otherwise could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: to damaged relationships and hurtful words
anger.question: Have I nursed anger rather than seeking reconciliation in interactions with others, potentially leading to damaged relationships and hurtful words?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
